alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:41PM EDT until July 31 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Whitley County in south central Kentucky... * Until 1145 PM EDT. * At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen across the area today. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Saxton, Red Ash, Mountain Ash, Lot, Pleasant View, Packard, Polly Camp, Nevisdale, Gatliff, Ayers, Wilkerson and Zion Hill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
